sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the Lord Deputy and Council. Tyrconnell. and to promote malicious slanders and calumnies, ... Ireland. Lord Deputy (1687-1689 : Tyrconnel) Tyrconnel, Richard Talbot, Earl of, 1630-1691.
2 sheets ([2] p.).
Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham, assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold by Andrew Crook at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and by Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street., Dublin, : 1688.
Title from caption and opening lines of text. Imprint from colophon. "Given at the Councel-chamber in Dublin the 7th day of December, 1688.". Arms 188. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======

Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham, assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold by Andrew Crook at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and by Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street., Dublin, : 1688.
Title from caption and opening lines of text. Imprint from colophon. "Given at the Councel-chamber in Dublin the 7th day of December, 1688.". Arms 188. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
